page.title: 01LANDSCAPE
page.content: Our Domesday block is a typical arable landscape of low hills and valleys, with scattered areas of woodland. The main London to Edinburgh railway line slices through from north to south, following the shallow valley of the River Glen. The B1176 Grantham to Stamford road follows the same route. Three settlements come into our area. {Little Bytham}is the largest, but it is cut in two by the northern boundary of our block (unfortunately our school is outside the area, as are the homes of many of the children). The small village of{Careby}is in the centre of our block (with some fields belonging to the tiny settlement of Aunby in the same parish). Part of the picturesque hamlet of{Holywell}is also included.{
